install.app_availability:
NextGraph App is available for download as a native app for your mobile, tablet, laptop and desktop.
The app supports iOS, Android, Linux, macOS, Windows, or any other platform with a modern browser.
install.has_wallet_warning:
A wallet is saved in this browser. If it is yours,
once the installation of the app will be finished,
choose the option "Login" on the app.
(do not create another wallet from the app).

no_wallet.description:
We could not find a wallet saved on this device.
If you already have a wallet, select "Log in", otherwise, select "Create Wallet" here below.

test.cannot_load_offline:
You are offline and using the web app. You need to connect to the broker at least once before you can start using the app locally because the web app does not keep a local copy of your documents.

Once connected, if you lose connectivity again, you will be able to have limited access to some functionalities. Sending binary files won't be possible, because the limit of local storage in your browser is around 5MB.

All those limitations will be lifted once the "UserStorage for Web" feature will be released. Stay tuned!

Check your connection status in the

login.heading: How to open your wallet? You have 2 options:

pazzle_steps.1: For each one of the 9 categories of images, you will be presented with the 15 possible image choices. The categories are shuffled at every login. They will not always appear in the same order.
pazzle_steps.2: At each category, only one of the 15 displayed choices is the correct image that belongs to your pazzle. Find it and tap or click on that one. The 15 images are shuffled too, they will not appear at the same position at each login. On a computer, you can also use the tab key on your keyboard to move to the desired item on the screen, then press the space bar to select each one.
pazzle_steps.3: Once you completed the last category, you will be presented with all the images you have previously selected. Their order is displayed as it was when you picked them. But this is not the correct order of the images in your pazzle. You now have to order them correctly.
pazzle_steps.4: You must remember which image should be the first one in your pazzle. Find it on the screen and click or tap on it. It will be greyed out and the number 1 will appear on top of it.
pazzle_steps.5: Move on to the second image of your pazzle (that you memorized). Find it on the screen and tap on it. Repeat this step until you reached the last image.
pazzle_steps.6: Finally, you are asked for your PIN code. Enter it by clicking or tapping on the digits.

mnemonic_steps.1: Enter your twelve words mnemonic in the input field. The words must be separated by spaces.
mnemonic_steps.2: Enter the PIN code that you chose when you created your wallet.

login.trust_device_allow_cookies: By selecting this option, you agree to saving some cookies on your browser.
login.trust_device_yes: Yes, save my wallet on this device
login.device_name_label: Name of this device. You can edit it now
login.order_emojis: Select each image in the correct order
login.wallet_opened:
Your wallet is opened!
Please wait while the app is loading...
login.qr_modal_description: Use this QRCode to log in with your wallet on new devices.
login.keep_wallet: Save to Device for Future Logins

wallet_create.redirecting_to_registration_page: Redirecting to the Broker Service Provider registration page
wallet_create.complete_in_popup: Complete the registration in the popup window
wallet_create.wallet_description:
A NextGraph Wallet is unique to each person. It stores your credentials and authorizations to access documents. You need one in order to start using NextGraph.

If you already have a wallet, you should not create a new one. Instead, login here with your existing wallet. If you never created a NextGraph Wallet before, please follow the instructions below in order to create your unique personal wallet.
wallet_create.has_wallet:
Some wallets are saved on this device,
to log in with one of them, click here.

wallet_about.title: What is a wallet?
wallet_about.1: Your wallet is a secure and encrypted small file that contains some important information that only you should have access to.
wallet_about.2: In your wallet, we store all the permissions to access documents you have been granted with, or that you have created yourself.
wallet_about.3: In order to open it, you will need to enter your pazzle and a PIN code of 4 digits. Your personal pazzle (contraction of puzzle and password) is composed of 9 images you should remember. The order of the images is important too.
wallet_about.4: Don't worry, it is easier to remember 9 images than a password like "69$g&ms%C*%", and it has the same strength as a complex password. The entropy of your pazzle is <b >66bits</b >, which is considered very high by all standards.
wallet_about.5: You should only create one unique wallet for yourself. All your accounts, identities and permissions will be added to this unique wallet later on. Do not create another wallet if you already have one. Instead, you will import your existing wallet in all the apps and websites where you need it.
wallet_about.6: Your wallet can be imported with the help of a small file that you download, or with a QRcode. In any case, you should never share this file or QRcode with anybody else.
wallet_about.7: We at NextGraph will never see the content of your wallet. It is encrypted and we do not know your pazzle, so we cannot see what is inside.
wallet_about.8: For the same reason, we won't be able to help you if you forget your pazzle or PIN code, or if you loose the wallet file. <span class="text-bold">   There is no "password recovery" option</span > in this case. You can note your pazzle down on a piece of paper until you remember it, but don't forget to destroy this note after a while.

wallet_create.select_server: NextGraph is based on an efficient decentralized P2P network, and in order to join this network and start using the app, you need to first select a broker server.

broker_about.title: What is a broker?
broker_about.1: The broker helps you keep all your data in sync, as it is connected to the internet 24/7 and keeps a copy of the updates for you. This way, even if the devices of the other participants are offline, you can still see their changes
broker_about.2: All your data is secure and end-to-end encrypted, and the broker cannot see the content of the documents as it does not have the keys to decrypt them.
broker_about.3: The broker helps you enforce your privacy as it hides your internet address (IP) from other users you share documents with.
broker_about.4: It will be possible in the future to use NextGraph without any broker and to have direct connections between peers, but this will imply a less smooth experience.
broker_about.5: At anytime you can decide to switch to another broker service provider or host it yourself. Your data is totally <b >portable</b > and can freely move to another broker.
broker_about.6: Soon we will offer you the opportunity to host your own broker at home or office. Instead of using a "broker service provider", you will own a small device that you connect behind your internet router. It is called NG Box and will be available soon.
broker_about.7: Organizations and companies have the opportunity to host a broker on-premise or in the cloud, as the software is open source. Individuals can also self-host a broker on any VPS server or at home, on their dedicated hardware.

wallet_create.choose_broker: Please choose one broker among the list
wallet_create.for_rest: For the rest of the world
wallet_create.registration_success: You have been successfully registered to {broker}

choose_pin.title: Let's start creating your wallet by choosing a PIN code
choose_pin.description:
We recommend you to choose a PIN code that you already know very well.
Your credit card PIN, by example, is a good choice.
We at NextGraph will never see your PIN.
choose_pin.rules: Here are the rules for the PIN:
choose_pin.1: It cannot be a series like 1234 or 8765.
choose_pin.2: The same digit cannot repeat more than once. By example 4484 is invalid.
choose_pin.3: Try to avoid birth dates, last digits of phone numbers, or zip codes

choose_security_phrase_and_image.title: Now let's enter a security phrase and a security image
choose_security_phrase_and_image.description:
As a verification step, this phrase and image will be presented to you every time you are about to enter your pazzle and PIN in order to unlock your wallet.
This security measure will prevent you from entering your pazzle and PIN on malicious sites and apps.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.warning: Every time you will use your wallet, if you do not see and recognize your own security phrase and image before entering your pazzle, please stop and DO NOT enter your pazzle, as you would be the victim of a phishing attempt.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.rules_title: Here are the rules for the security phrase and image:
choose_security_phrase_and_image.1: The phrase should be at least 10 characters long
choose_security_phrase_and_image.2: It should be something you will remember, but not something too personal.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.3: Do not enter your full name, nor address, nor phone number.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.4: Instead, you can enter a quote, a small sentence that you like, or something meaningless to others, but unique to you.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.5: The image should be minimum 150x150px. There is no need to provide more than 400x400px as it will be scaled down anyway.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.6: We accept several formats like JPEG, PNG, GIF, WEBP and more.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.7: The image should be unique to you. But it should not be too personal neither.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.8: Do not upload your face picture, this is not a profile pic.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.9: The best would be a landscape you like or any other picture that you will recognize as unique.
choose_security_phrase_and_image.10: Please be aware that other people who are sharing this device with you, will be able to see this image and phrase.

wallet_create.pins_no_match: You didn't enter the same PIN twice

save_wallet_options.description:
There are 4 options to choose before we can create your wallet. Those options can help you to use and keep your wallet. But we also want to be careful with your security and privacy.

Remember that in any case, once your wallet will be created, you will download a file that you should keep privately somewhere on your device, USB key or hard-disk. This is the default way you can use and keep your wallet. Now let's look at some options that can make your life a bit easier.
save_wallet_options.trust_description: If you do, if this device is yours, or it is used by a few trusted persons of your family or workplace, and you would like to login again from this device in the future, then you can save your wallet on this device. To the contrary, if this device is public and shared by strangers, do not save your wallet here.
save_wallet_options.trust_toggle: Save my wallet on this device?
save_wallet_options.device_name_description: To see which devices you are connected with, every device should have a name (e.g. Bob's laptop). Please enter it here.
save_wallet_options.cloud: Keep a copy in the cloud?
save_wallet_options.cloud_description: Are you afraid that you will loose the file containing your wallet? If this would happen, your wallet would be lost forever, together with all your documents. We can keep an encrypted copy of your wallet in our cloud. Only you will be able to download it with a special link. You would have to keep this link safely though. By selecting this option, you agree to the
save_wallet_options.cloud_toggle: Save my wallet in the cloud?
save_wallet_options.cloud_tos: Terms of Service of our cloud
save_wallet_options.pdf: Create a PDF file of your wallet?
save_wallet_options.pdf_description: We can prepare for you a PDF file containing all the information of your wallet, unencrypted. You should print this file and then delete the PDF (and empty the trash). Keep this printed document in a safe place. It contains all the information to regenerate your wallet in case you lost access to it.
save_wallet_options.pdf_toggle: Create a PDF of my wallet?
save_wallet_options.link: Create a link to access your wallet easily?
save_wallet_options.link_description: When you want to use your wallet on the web or from other devices, we can help you find your wallet by creating a simple link accessible from anywhere. Only you will have access to this link. In order to do so, we will keep your wallet ID and some information about your broker on our cloud servers. If you prefer to opt out, just uncheck this option. By selecting this option, you agree to the
save_wallet_options.link_toggle: Create a link to my wallet?

wallet_create.download_wallet_description: Please download your wallet and keep it in a safe location
wallet_create.download_wallet_done:
Your wallet file has been downloaded into your "Downloads" folder, with the name
{download_name}
Please move it to a safe and durable place.
wallet_create.your_pazzle:
Here below is your Pazzle.
The order of each image is important!
wallet_create.your_mnemonic: And here is your mnemonic (your alternative passphrase):
wallet_create.unlock_tips_1: You can use both the pazzle or the mnemonic to unlock your wallet. The pazzle is easier to remember. The mnemonic is useful in some special cases. We recommend that you use the pazzle. <span class="font-bold text-xl" >Copy both on a piece of paper.</span > You should try to memorize the pazzle. Once you did, you won't need the paper anymore.
wallet_create.unlock_tips_2: Now click on "Continue to Login" and select your new wallet.
wallet_create.unlock_tips_3: It is important that you login with this wallet at least once from this {platform, select, browser {browser tab} other {device}}, while connected to the internet, so your personal site can be created on your broker.
wallet_create.continue_confirm: Did you write down your login credentials?
wallet_create.continue_confirm_description: The pazzle and the mnemonic <span class="font-bold"> will not be shown to you again</span >. Please make sure, you have written them down.

wallet_login.select_wallet: Select a wallet to login with
wallet_login.from_import.title: Your wallet has been transferred
wallet_login.from_import.description: Your wallet has been received from the other device!
wallet_login.from_import.instruction: To finish the import, please log in.
wallet_login.logged_in:
You are logged in.
please wait while the app is loading

wallet_login_qr.title: Import Wallet with QR-Code
wallet_login_qr.scan.description:
To import your wallet from another device, generate an export-QR-Code there. On the other device, go to
User Panel > Wallet > Export by scanning QR-Code to export.
wallet_login_qr.scan.modal.title: Scan Wallet QR-Code
wallet_login_qr.gen.description:
To import your wallet from another device, you have to generate a QR-Code here on this device, and then scan it with your other device (the one where your wallet is located for now).
If your other device does not have a camera, then you have to use another method for importing your wallet here.
wallet_login_qr.offline_advice: If you do not have internet on this device, you can use the "Import a Wallet file" method instead.
wallet_login_qr.gen.letsgo:
Ready? On your other device, you first have to be logged-in (wallet is opened) and then you go to
User Panel > Wallet > Scan QR to export.
Then on this present device, click below on the
Generate QR-Code button.
wallet_login_qr.gen.generated:
Scan this QR-Code from the other device.
You have 5 minutes to do so.

wallet_login_textcode.title: Import Wallet from TextCode
wallet_login_textcode.description:
To generate a TextCode, open a logged in device and go to
User Panel > Wallet > Generate TextCode to export.
wallet_login_textcode.enter_here: Enter your TextCode here below and click on Import button

errors.AlreadyExists:
The user is already registered with the selected broker.
Try logging in instead.
errors.SerializationError: The data could not be serialized.
errors.EncryptionError: Your wallet could not be opened. You probably did a mistake.
errors.InvalidCreateAccount: An error occurred creating the account.
errors.JsStorageKeyNotFound: Could not find JavaScript storage key.
errors.LocalBrokerNotInitialized: The local broker is not initialized.
errors.JsStorageReadError: Could not read from JavaScript Storage.
errors.JsStorageWriteError: Could not write to JavaScript Storage.
errors.CannotSaveWhenInMemoryConfig: Saving while configured for In-Memory is not possible.
errors.SiteNotFoundOnBroker: The site cannot be found on the broker
errors.MalformedEvent: The event has an invalid format.
errors.LocalBrokerIsNotHeadless: The local broker is not headless.
errors.ExportWalletTimeOut: The wallet-export session has expired. Try again.
errors.ConnectionError: Could not connect to the server.
errors.IncompatibleQrCode: You scanned a NextGraph QR-Code that is of the wrong type.

wallet_sync.offline_warning:
You cannot transfer your wallet when offline.
Please make sure you are connected to the internet first.
wallet_sync.textcode.usage_warning: You have to exchange this TextCode with the other device by any means available to you (email, other messenger apps, etc...). It is highly recommended to use a tool that is end-to-end encrypted. If you can, you should use the "Import with QR-Code" option instead, as it is safer and simpler. If your devices are not connected to the internet, then you can use the "Import a Wallet File" option. In this case, you will transfer the wallet file with a USB key, from one device to the other, or for mobile, by connecting your mobile with the USB cable, to the computer, and then transferring the file with the File Transfer utility on Android, or AirDrop/Finder/iTunes on an iPhone/mac/PC. We do not recommend uploading your wallet file to any cloud service.
wallet_sync.server_transfer_notice:
Both devices need to be online.
During this wallet transfer, your wallet will be temporarily and securely stored on our servers for up to 5 minutes, using two levels of encryption.
We at NextGraph will never be able to read your wallet, your PIN, your pazzle nor your mnemonic.
wallet_sync.expiry: The TextCode will be valid for 5 minutes.
wallet_sync.error:
An error occurred while synchronizing your wallet:
{error}
wallet_sync.no_camera:
Unfortunately, your device does not have a camera.
You cannot scan any QR-Code.
In order to export your wallet to another device, you will have to use another method.
wallet_sync.no_camera_alternatives: You have 2 other options: "Import a Wallet file" (transfer it using a USB key by example, useful if you are offline) or "Import a TextCode" (which is a text you will have to transfer with another messaging app).
